posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

But I can relate in a way all the same. If someone is as much of an overthinker as I can tend to trend, we might bring out more of the stuttery, stammery, stilt-our-future-flow traits in eachother. I get along best with people who know how much heart and thought I put into even the poor grammar, poorer punctuation ("I write in my voice..It's my truth!"), meme-filled sorts of responses; I get on better still with the people who don't hold it against me if I *have to* occasionally sacrifice quality for the sake of time, the sake of sanity, the sake of responding at all --and those are the people who seem to really, truly value my walls of wordplay when they come, too. I know this is usually a thing you're not supposed to do in polite neurotypical society if you're self aware, but that's my attempt at relating, showing active-understanding by saying "We birds of a feather [B]arn [B]rowl fr fr...ovo"
>I am hurt if ...
What sorts of responses or interactions make you feel dismissed? Aside from, understandably, no response at all.
>If I say something ...
I think the only answer to this I've found is not letting the seemingly-set-in-stone nature of the internet trick you into thinking you're unreasonably held to your static-in-context standpoints. We are fluid but guided by so much, above and below. Maybe solidified, from a subjective perspective, as we leave this realm and our legacy behind (re: Your post from the other day)...But, fingers crossed, knock on wood, we both still have some time before that deadline. Let yourself be The Great Work in progress.

Si caught off guard is panic mode. Ne starts firing neurons in all directions and you don't know what to do, which is the opposite of what an Ne dominant is as a person. It's possible for ENTPs to have the Si punched through the tertiary Fe and to start sweating like a retarded INTP, but most commonly it's expressed with agression and mistrust. As an ENTP it happens all the time when my Si takes a blow, say I can't find something important or I'm given something I don't want, I start blaming the people around me for absurd reasons. It's never the dominant Ne's fault however, it's always related to the tertiary: either someone's fucking with me or for ENFPs I guess they start making stupid rationalisations.
Now I'm a balanced ENTP, I learned the hard way not to give a fuck anymore. There's rarely ever a situation when I'm stressed on my inferior Si. The Ne dom is powerful and you have to learn to control its outputs.

Why's it your favorite thread? Okay let's see

>Superstitious
Agnostic or a mild believer. If I'm reading or watching something related to the paranormal, I do find myself believing much of what I'm reading or hearing and consider it credible, but it never solidifies as something I firmly and wholeheartedly believe in.
>Others who disagree
That's fine. I hate dissenting opinions on subjects I feel strongly about, but this isn't a subject I feel strongly about. My own faith is weak, as I said.
>religious
No, but I went to church with my sister a couple of times for the hell of it and think it's a very nice environment. I certainly see the value of religion and wish I could believe in it.
>political
Yeah.
>personality changes
That's a really complicated subject that I could easily write 20k characters about, never mind 2k. My personality underwent almost nothing but negative changes during my childhood and teens, and a mixture of positive changes along with further forms of decay from the age of 19 on. I'd say there's been 10 personality versions/eras/paradigms with number 7 (2011-2015) being the most unstable.
>best quality
Loyal, generally nice in my day-to-day life, during arguments I try to be fair-minded and intellectually honest and willing to concede to points
>worst quality
Objectively speaking, probably anger issues (which run in my family, five out of the seven in my immediate family being prone to extremes of anger)... but I actually don't mind those since I find anger fun, exciting, and cleansing of the soul. So I'd probably say the fact that I'm often too lazy, tired, and lethargic to be as of good of a friend as I should be.

>>71506499
INTP. Glad to have something to help me procrastinate. I'll do all of them.

>Are you superstitious, or do you believe in supernatural events? What do you think of others who do not share the same belief/disbelief?
Generally no, but I do have an irrational belief in the nature of luck. I will not go into all of it but the general principle of my belief is that luck is a limited but replenishing resource. For example, if something fortunate happens, depending on just how improbable that event was, nothing so good can happen to me again until my pool of luck replenishes. As such, I generally avoid casually relying on chance so as to not accidentally deplete my resources and cause me misfortune when I do something I actually want to succeed at.
>Are you religious?
No, but I do believe in a concept of divinity.
>Are you political?
No. I'm the kind of person that doesn't care until something effects me personally which some would say is a bit scummy but it is what it is and I can't force myself care.
>Have you experienced a significant change in your personality or disposition? Perhaps developed new values or core beliefs? What triggered it?
No. Though some things have changed here and there, I am still the same person at my core that I was a decade ago.
>Which quality of yours do you value/appreciate the most?
My ability to rationally choose the irrational. I may have some bizarre beliefs but you can be sure that I thought out every aspect of it before deciding that is what was best for me. I am glad that I am open minded enough that no option out of the question for me.
>Which quality of yours are you ashamed of the most?
Nothing. My flaws, however deep and alarming some of them may be, contribute to making me the person that I am and I love the person that I am. I would not get rid of a single one.

>>71511028
>>71511417
>Plato-nically and psychologically speaking a perfect form of something is pretty much an archetype of an archetype
Jung/archetypes are neo-Platonic, yea. Platonically the real world is only the imperfect copies of the image, shadows in the cave. Then, the primary project of Platonism and its derivatives is how to turn away from the false copies, how to reconnect with the perfect, the prototypes, the ideal. But to touch on our talk earlier, I think there is a mistake here. The real world is indeed shadows, but so too is the ideal. You leave Plato's cave, only to find another cave beyond, always another in which to hide, with more shadows.

What is eternal is not the ideal, but idealization itself, the longing for ideals. Then, the question is not whether to cling to the real or the ideal, but how you idealize, and how your life reaches for that which it idealizes.

>I wonder if transtypeism and type changes can be seen in brain scans... :3c
How lucky I am to stumble into such a question, eh?
Laconically speaking, as someone in these threads brought up the importance of nuance (https://desuarchive.org/r9k/thread/68897322/#68901346), the degree of changes of accuracy would be different between different types of brain scanning, with their own mechanisms (and nuances) of scanning, susceptibility to noise and sensitivity each. Study discussed in the link, as it checks out, was based on inaccurate, overly sensitive AND noise-susceptible EEG-scanning while additionally having a minuscule sample size (which definitely doesn't help combating the effects of interference of random EM field noises onto obtaining meaningful results).
With methods much more efficient*, it would be inevitable* to notice the flaws of the MBTI - there are more "cognitive functions" than 8.
Just because of inefficiency and mismanagement in priorities, the research in psychology (and related fields) is (fresh and nicely done outlier studies aside) generally like a century behind what could be possible to reach now. That's to add there still will be pace to pick up, as the end result differences on behavior have* influences also stemming from sub-cellular levels and there are still approaches and implementations to be discovered and made to get proper results for research this deep

>>71499072
Yes to some extent, 5-meo-mipt and 3-mmc were kind of popular a while back before they got added to the law, and 1p-lsd was a thing until recently, openly sold by twitter accounts importing it from Europe.

The issue is that even if the products you get are technically legal on paper, the cops and the law WILL fuck with you.
For example 1p-LSD is still technically legal, but if I were to order it from NL to JP it would get intercepted at the border, and I would get brought in for questioning about "importing dangerous substances" and stuff like that. Even if they can't really punish me in the end, they will come to my house, maybe question my neighbors and my coworkers, that kind of thing. And it will be written on my record forever.

Some Japs do that kind of thing because they're marginals and don't care about reputational damage, but as a foreigner that has to renew his visa/lease once in a while, this is impossible. If I do this, I will never get another visa or good apartment ever gain. Any lease or job you get has a clause that if you get involved in drugs, they can kick you out right away.

So I only do legal stuff. Which can be enough depending on what drugs you like. Basically you have to like downers.
Nicotine, alcohol, GBL, phenibut, tramadol, codeine, DXM, etc.

I'm more of a stim-empathogen or psych kind of guy so I'm dissatisfied, but I still like alcohol and GBL so it's okay I guess.

posts.com: Anyone have experience with Nitrous? What's it like how long does it last because it seems like a minute or two. How easy is it to harm yourself? Pic for attention

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>71514100
heres how it goes:
Lasts for 30 seconds but can be quite profound
This is because your red blood cells cant differentiate between nitrous oxide and oxygen so, despite depriving your brain of oxygen, your body doesn't respond - it thinks you're breathing normally.
You wont die or experience nerve damage unless you do a ridiculous amount, usually all at once. Putting one canister into a balloon is standard, but frankly using two in a balloon was always the best. You can stack them, depending on the balloon type, I recall getting six canisters into a balloon before, but dont push it, because while it is fleeting, its a very relieving and therefore behaviorally addictive thing to do. My friends and I used to crush several boxes each on a good night. Also smoke weed first makes it way better.

It's projection and somewhat denial. Bullies tend to make fun of others based on qualities of those people they see in themselves. They hate a certain thing about themselves, see it in someone else, and lash out at them in a roundabout way of taking out their anger on it.

So a person sees a pedophile or just someone spouting an opinion that could be twisted to imply pedophilia, they self identify with it for a moment, then lash out at that person as a form of self-hate. It almost gets suspicious when some people (for seemingly no reason) ruthlessly wish to accuse people or things of pedophilia. They feel as if they've conquered their own problem by compensating for it by confronting someone else about the pedophilia rather than themselves. I can think of no reason for such vitriolic and persistent hate.

A normal person would approach rationally. If you don't approach rationally and calmly and rather are accusatory and jump to conclusions then there is obviously something wrong with you or your relationship to the issue.

>>71511637
>I could be convinced of gene editing though.
That's definitely a possibility in the future. Technically it's possible now but regulations and entanglements with ethics helps stop it from being viable. For example we have plenty of results for various gene alterations that can improve lifespan, give immunity/resistance to certain diseases(That's what that Chinese doctor did for some embryos in regards to HIV iirc) and also remove certain congenital diseases from appearing in someone's offspring. There's also embryo selection where you essentially fertilize a bunch of embryos in vtiro and then compare the genetics of said embryos to pick which ones you want to keep. The latter I imagine wouldn't be to your liking since it's the termination of life at its very root. Some of the gene editting stuff is also more risky, the Chinese doctor got flack because crispr can also cause massive deletions of segments of DNA instead of just replacing a segment with what you want.

>>71512275
I am almost 26 and extremely socially inept, khhv and haven't made a friend in probably ~7 years. I've gone to see a few metal bands live, and it's always a good time, provided that I have a few drinks. There's nothing quite like the atmosphere of getting drunk while seeing a really loud band play metal. Even someone like me who is completely anxious about everything socially was able to go and just get drunk and headbang a bit. However, I wouldn't expect to make any friends especially women. You have to be a social person to do that, you have to be the kind of person that is going to start a conversation with random strangers. Many people (most people probably) that are there will be with a friend or group of friends (assuming you are a real robot, you will be going alone) so you'll just kinda be the loner, which is ok, but don't expect people just to magically come up and start talking to you. It's on you to do that. I'm not able to do that. I just go for the music and booze and still have a good time, except for the guilt and self hatred after I go home realizing I wasn't able to talk to anyone, or have any women interested in me, and knowing that I got some permanent hearing damage for my trouble. Really, as a hypochondriac, the hearing damage really bothers me so I pick and choose carefully when going see a band live is worth it. Often it's better just to stay in my bedroom and get drunk listening to music rather than going out because a) I have to usually drive drunk home and b) I get upset with myself for seeing all the normies and not making any social connections. I would say what you should do is just look at local bands, pick out one you like, and go there and try to have a good time. Even if it goes badly, it's probably still more interesting than spending the nth night alone in your bedroom wishing your life was better.

posts.sub: Part of me Misses being in Chronic Pain
posts.com:
I grew up in pain. From 9 to 25 I had horrible burning pain all the way down my arm that doctors could not figure out.
All I wanted was it gone. I wanted it so much. A few years ago I got my wish. The case worker for my insurance got sick of all the money I spent going to random doctors and sent me to Mayo Clinic. A bunch of scans later and I had two surgerys. One to repair my Labrum and another to decompress the nerves going into my left arm.
The pain that I grew up with was gone. My shoulder and arm are permafucked and will always be weak on my left side due to nerve damage but the pain is gone.

Now 3 years later I realize. I worked out and kept in shape to keep the pain away. I got out of bed because laying down for too long was painful. I went to school because it distracted me.
I have gone full neet now. I can lay flat and feel no physical discomfort. Its still euphoric, even 3 years later.
I almost wish I had not had the surgery.
I hope me saying this does not jinx the surgery, or maybe I hope I will wake up with the arm wide throbbing pain again.
When in your formative years your whole motivation was to remove pain and now the pain is gone. Its a trip dude. God damn.
